result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Nicholas Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, assessments and surcharges by 5-20-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

The first 10 days are straight time--the balance can be with Huber for the Day Reporting Program--no objection to electronic monitoring while in the program. Court advises the defendant cannot vote until his civil rights are restored. Must provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done.
Court advises the defendant may not possess a firearm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan Nicholas Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.

Court advises the defendant may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample, and pay the DNA surcharge, if not previously done, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 8 months at the House of Correction - the first 10 days are straight time - the balance can be with Huber for the Day Reporting Program - no objection to electronic monitoring while in the program -  and 10 days credit; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by 5-20-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defendant Ryan Nicholas Johnson in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
No reply from defendant.

Defendant Ryan Nicholas Johnson in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea hearing scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
Defendant/Surety's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.

14RM021026  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04-19-14
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($750.00 signature bond) ad

Attorney Victoria M McCandless in court, defendant Ryan Nicholas Johnson not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Bail argued by counsel.  Court sets bail at $50 cash TOT to Justice Point: 1) no illegally controlled substances; 2) random screening.    Case remains set for 5-6-14.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.
DEFENDANT  FAILS  TO  COMPLY  WITH  MONITORING.

Defendant Ryan Nicholas Johnson not in court.  No A Attorney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

NO FILE IN COURT.  Defendant failing to comply with conditions of bail, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Case remains set for 5-6-14 for pretrial.

Defendant Ryan Nicholas Johnson in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant was living with his mother and was evicted from her house.  Court admonishes the defendant as to keeping in contact with Justice Point.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
Court will address at the next hearing date./ds
Violation report received and filed./ds

Defendant Ryan Nicholas Johnson in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Paul Hauer for Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 3/20/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ryan Nicholas Johnson in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Defendant Ryan Nicholas Johnson in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
